label.involvement: Held various leadership roles including Minister of the Environment and Deputy Minister of the Environment, leading environmental policies and initiatives.

supporting_quotes:
In office
30 March 2010 – 12 May 2016
In May 2010 she was appointed Minister of the Environment, and, in January 2011 she was reappointed to the position by Dilma Rousseff, Brazil's new President.

Izabella Mônica Vieira Teixeira
(born 9 October 1961) was the Brazilian
Minister of the Environment.
In October 2010 Teixeira made a statement on behalf of Brazil at the 10th conference on the Convention on Biological Diversity

Born
Izabella Mônica Vieira Teixeira
(1961-10-09)
9 October 1961 (age 64)
Brasília, Federal District, Brazil
In October 2010 Teixeira made a statement on behalf of Brazil at the 10th conference on the Convention on Biological Diversity in Nagoya, Japan
She also spoke at the 2010 United Nations Climate Change Conference in Cancún, Mexico.

supporting_quotes: With Teixeira as Environment Minister, Brazil has also refused to sign the anti-deforestation pledge that aims to reduce deforestation by 2030, dealing a blow to the Climate Change summit that took place in New York in October 2014.
events.notes: Clear indication of Teixeira serving as Environment Minister, with specific actions taken in that role.

quotes: On 24 September 2012, Teixeira was appointed by UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon to serve on the High-Level Panel of Eminent Persons on the Post-2015 Development Agenda.

Teixeira is devoted to reversing the deforestation of the Amazon Rainforest, and achieved an 84% reduction in deforestation from 2004 to 2012, a 'remarkable feat that is a tribute to her courage to push against the tide of destruction and is a significant initiative from Brazil on climate change mitigation'.
From August 2012 to July 2013, the rate of deforestation increased by 29% in the Amazônia Legal (Legal Amazon),
and from 2013 to 2014, it rose by 358%.

With Teixeira as Environment Minister, Brazil has also refused to sign the anti-deforestation pledge that aims to reduce deforestation by 2030, dealing a blow to the Climate Change summit that took place in New York in October 2014.

On 24 May 2014, Teixeira announced a pollution-reducing initiative aimed at making the 2014 FIFA World Cup the most environmentally friendly ever by allowing companies to buy carbon credits in exchange for the right to advertise themselves as official 'green seal' World Cup sponsors.

supporting_quotes: From 2008 to 2010, she was the Deputy Minister of the Environment.
events.notes: Clear role and time period mentioned.

quotes: She holds a Ph.D. in Energy Planning and was Brazil’s Minister of the Environment from 2010 to 2016.
From 2008 to 2010, she was the Deputy Minister of the Environment.
In 2015, Teixeira was Head of the Brazilian Delegation on negotiations of the Paris Agreement of the UN Convention on Climate Change.
For her outstanding career, in 2013 Teixeira received the United Nations Environment Program “Champions of the Earth” award for Policy Leadership.

organizations.name: PPG7
quotes: Teixeira’s international experience comes from the negotiation and management of international projects in Brazil, such as PPG7.

organizations.name: UN’s High-Level Panel on Global Sustainability
quotes: By invitation of the UN’s Secretary General, she was a member of the High-Level Panel on Global Sustainability.

organizations.name: UN’s Rio+20 Conference on Sustainable Development
quotes: She was also a key leader of the 2012 UN’s Rio+20 Conference on Sustainable Development.

organizations.name: UN’s High-Level Panel on the Post-2015 Development Agenda (SDG’s Agenda 2030)
quotes: After Rio+20 she was again appointed by the UN’s Secretary-General as a member of the High-Level Panel on the Post-2015 Development Agenda (SDG’s Agenda 2030).

organizations.name: International Resource Panel–IRP/UNEP-ONU
quotes: Today, she is Co-Chair of the International Resource Panel–IRP/UNEP-ONU, a Board Member of UN DESA, a member of the Administrative Council of the National Bank for Economic and Social Development (BNDES), a Senior Fellow of Institute Arapyaú, a Counselor of the Fernando Henrique Cardoso Foundation, Trustee Emeritus for Environment and Climate Change of Brazilian Center for International Relations-CEBRI, and a member of the Global Commission on the Geopolitics of Energy Transformation of IRENA.

supporting_quotes: She played a key role in the negotiation of the Paris Agreement and was appointed, in 2012, to serve on the High-Level Panel of Eminent Persons for the Post-2015 Development Agenda.
events.notes: Appointment to a specific panel in 2012.

quotes: Throughout her career, Izabella Teixeira held different administrative positions in the Ministry of Environment, in the Rio de Janeiro State Government and in IBAMA, where she joined in 1984.
She played a key role in the negotiation of the Paris Agreement and was appointed, in 2012, to serve on the High-Level Panel of Eminent Persons for the Post-2015 Development Agenda.
In 2013, she won the UN Environment’s “Champions of the Earth” Global Award for her contribution to reducing deforestation in the Amazon.
The page has been updated in May 2024.

label.label: UN Environment Recognition

supporting_quotes: For her outstanding career, in 2013 Teixeira received the United Nations Environment Program “Champions of the Earth” award for Policy Leadership.
events.notes: Clear award and time period mentioned.

quotes: She holds a Ph.D. in Energy Planning and was Brazil’s Minister of the Environment from 2010 to 2016.
From 2008 to 2010, she was the Deputy Minister of the Environment.
In 2015, Teixeira was Head of the Brazilian Delegation on negotiations of the Paris Agreement of the UN Convention on Climate Change.
For her outstanding career, in 2013 Teixeira received the United Nations Environment Program “Champions of the Earth” award for Policy Leadership.

organizations.name: International Resource Panel–IRP/UNEP-ONU
quotes: Today, she is Co-Chair of the International Resource Panel–IRP/UNEP-ONU, a Board Member of UN DESA, a member of the Administrative Council of the National Bank for Economic and Social Development (BNDES), a Senior Fellow of Institute Arapyaú, a Counselor of the Fernando Henrique Cardoso Foundation, Trustee Emeritus for Environment and Climate Change of Brazilian Center for International Relations-CEBRI, and a member of the Global Commission on the Geopolitics of Energy Transformation of IRENA.

Dr. Izabella Mônica Vieira Teixeira is a native Brazilian.
Teixeira’s international experience comes from the negotiation and management of international projects in Brazil, such as PPG7.

supporting_quotes: In 2013, she won the UN Environment’s “Champions of the Earth” Global Award for her contribution to reducing deforestation in the Amazon.

quotes: Throughout her career, Izabella Teixeira held different administrative positions in the Ministry of Environment, in the Rio de Janeiro State Government and in IBAMA, where she joined in 1984.
She played a key role in the negotiation of the Paris Agreement and was appointed, in 2012, to serve on the High-Level Panel of Eminent Persons for the Post-2015 Development Agenda.
In 2013, she won the UN Environment’s “Champions of the Earth” Global Award for her contribution to reducing deforestation in the Amazon.

Izabella Teixeira
Former Minister of Environment, co-chair of the International Resource Panel
Brazil
